content:
<ce:para view="all">Crystal data and structure refinement, atomic coordinates, bond lengths and angles, the IR spectrum are available from the authors on request.</ce:para><ce:simple-para view="all">Complex <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>: A methanol solution (20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of Cu(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>6H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.30<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 1.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was added dropwise to a methanol solution (30<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>L (0.12<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and triethylamine (0.11<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 1.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) under stirring for 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min. Dark-red block crystals of <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> suitable for single crystal X-ray structural diffraction were obtained by slowly evaporating the solvent at room temperature. Anal. Calcd. for (C<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Cu<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>: C, 31.8; H, 1.9; N, 14.3. Found: C, 31.7; H, 2.0; N, 14.2%. Complex <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>: A methanol solution (20<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of CuCl<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>
<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>·<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O (0.17<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 1.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was added dropwise to a methanol solution (30<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>L (0.12<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.50<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and triethylamine (0.11<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 1.0<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) under stirring for 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min. Dark-green block crystals of <ce:bold>3</ce:bold> suitable for single crystal X-ray structural diffraction were obtained by slowly evaporating the solvent at room temperature. Anal. Calcd. for (C<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>N<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Cu<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>Cl<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>: C, 35.7; H, 2.1; N, 9.6. Found: C, 35.7; H, 2.1; N, 9.5%.</ce:simple-para>
clean_text:
Crystal data and structure refinement, atomic coordinates, bond lengths and angles, the IR spectrum are available from the authors on request.

Complex 1: A methanol solution (20mL) of Cu(NO3)2 ⋅6H2O (0.30g, 1.0mmol) was added dropwise to a methanol solution (30mL) of H2L (0.12g, 0.50mmol) and triethylamine (0.11g, 1.0mmol) under stirring for 5min. Dark-red block crystals of 2 suitable for single crystal X-ray structural diffraction were obtained by slowly evaporating the solvent at room temperature. Anal. Calcd. for (C13H9N3O2)2Cu4(NO3)4: C, 31.8; H, 1.9; N, 14.3. Found: C, 31.7; H, 2.0; N, 14.2%. Complex 2: A methanol solution (20mL) of CuCl2 ⋅2H2O (0.17g, 1.0mmol) was added dropwise to a methanol solution (30mL) of H2L (0.12g, 0.50mmol) and triethylamine (0.11g, 1.0mmol) under stirring for 5min. Dark-green block crystals of 3 suitable for single crystal X-ray structural diffraction were obtained by slowly evaporating the solvent at room temperature. Anal. Calcd. for (C13H9N3O2)2Cu4Cl4: C, 35.7; H, 2.1; N, 9.6. Found: C, 35.7; H, 2.1; N, 9.5%.
